SEARCH
Module jtamaro
Package jtamaro.io

Class IO

java.lang.Object
jtamaro.io.IO
public final class IO extends Object
This class provides procedures to visualize graphics and perform I/O operations such as reading and writing files, interacting with the STDOUT and STDIN and more.

Note: all methods in this class are impure!

    • print

      public static <T> void print(Sequence<T> sequence)
      Print the given sequence, one element right after the next, to standard output. Each element is converted into a String to be printed. This does not add any newlines.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements
      Parameters:
      sequence - the sequence to print

      public static <F, S> void print(Pair<F,S> pair)

      Parameters:

    • animate

      public static void animate(Sequence<Graphic> graphics, boolean loop)
      Open a window with an animation of the given graphics, at 25 frames per second.
      Parameters:
      graphics - sequence of graphics (frames) to animate
      loop - whether to loop the animation

    • animate

      public static void animate(Sequence<Graphic> graphics, boolean loop, int millisecondsPerFrame)
      Open a window with an animation.
      Parameters:
      graphics - sequence of graphics (frames) to animate
      loop - whether to loop the animation
      millisecondsPerFrame - delay between frames

    • showFilmStrip

      public static void showFilmStrip(Sequence<Graphic> graphics)
      Open a window with a scrollable filmstrip, with a frame for each of the given graphics. This method automatically detects the width and height of the frames. For empty sequences, it uses a default frame size. For sequences with a definite size, it determines the maximum width and height.
      Parameters:
      graphics - sequence of graphics (frames) to show in the filmstrip

    • showFilmStrip

      public static void showFilmStrip(Sequence<Graphic> graphics, int frameWidth, int frameHeight)
      Open a window with a scrollable filmstrip, with a frame for each of the given graphics.
      Parameters:
      graphics - sequence of graphics (frames) to show in the filmstrip
      frameWidth - the width of frames (should be at least the maximum of all the graphics' widths)
      frameHeight - the height of frames (should be at least the maximum of all the graphics' heights)

    • interact

      public static <M> Interaction<M> interact(M initialModel)
      Open a window with an interactive application.
      Type Parameters:
      M - Model type
      Parameters:
      initialModel - The initial model state of the application
      Returns:
      an Interaction that can be further configured and run
